head.title: Henry Ogilby to Wed Anne Phillips in May

hedline.hl1: Henry Ogilby to Wed Anne Phillips in May

block.p: LEAD: Anne Crocker Phillips, an associate in the Boston law firm Ropes & Gray, and Henry McFarlan Ogilby, an office information systems marketing manager with the Digital Equipment Corporation in Merrimack, N.H., plan to be married in May.

LEAD: Anne Crocker Phillips, an associate in the Boston law firm Ropes & Gray, and Henry McFarlan Ogilby, an office information systems marketing manager with the Digital Equipment Corporation in Merrimack, N.H., plan to be married in May.

Anne Crocker Phillips, an associate in the Boston law firm Ropes & Gray, and Henry McFarlan Ogilby, an office information systems marketing manager with the Digital Equipment Corporation in Merrimack, N.H., plan to be married in May.

The future bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Asa E. Phillips Jr. of Brookline, Mass., and Seal Harbor, Me., who have announced her engagement to a son of Lydia Phippen Ogilby of Belmont, Mass., and Randolph Hill, N.H., and the late John D. Ogilby.

Miss Phillips graduated from the Winsor School; Harvard University, where she was elected to Phi Beta Kappa, and the University of Virginia School of Law. She made her debut at the Salem Assembly and the Boston Cotillion. Her father is a lawyer in Boston.

Mr. Ogilby, a graduate of the Belmont Hill School and Colby College, received an M.B.A. degree from Babson College. He is in Digital Equipment's international marketing division and was until recently a sales director in the Geneva office.
